description:
Bird Kazami, aiming to become a pro Blader, meets former champion Ekusu Kurosu, also known as 'Kamen X', and forms a team so that they can aim for the "top" of the X Tower. But what awaits them is a spectacular battle that no one has ever seen before. The yet unseen 'X'. The super accelerated (Xtreme) Beyblade runs through a new era!

(Source: Official website)
synonyms: ベイブレードエックス

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast

tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

node.description: [Personal Website](http://2st.jp/500/) | [Website (Kawamoto Muno Studio)](https://kawamuno.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ushimilksan) Homura Kawamoto is a Japanese manga artist. Together with [Hikaru Muno](https://anilist.co/staff/128746/) they make up the studio Kawamoto Muno Studio.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/poipheno) | [Website (Kawamoto Muno Studio)](https://kawamuno.com/)

Together with [Homura Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/119000/Homura-Kawamoto) they make up the studio Kawamoto Muno Studio.

[Website](http://posuka.iinaa.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/demizuposuka)

A freelance artist. She made her debut in 2008 with a mini-series published in the manga prepublication magazine Corocoro.

"The Art of Posuka Demizu", her first artbook that gathers her drawings, was published in 2016.

__[Website](http://www.oneokrock.com/index.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ONEOKROCK_japan)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/ONEOKROCKchannel)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ONEOKROCK)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7k73EtZwoPs516ZxE72KsO)__

__Introduction:__
One Ok Rock, stylized as ONE OK ROCK is a Japanese rock band. They have been playing many different styles of music, with songs ranging from alternative rock to emo to post-hardcore to pop rock.

__Biography:__
The band's name comes from "one o'clock", the time that the band used to practice their music on weekends. They chose to play at one o'clock in the morning because it was cheaper to use the rehearsal space during such hours. However, noticing that the Japanese language made no distinction between R's and L's, "O'CLOCK" transformed into "O'CROCK" or "O'KROCK", which later transformed into "OK ROCK". In addition, One Ok Rock can be expressed as "10969" (wan-ō-ku-ro-ku). This band makes their music in Japanese, English and mainly in a mixture of both of the languages.

__Members:__
Name: Tooru Yamashita
Birthplace: Osaka Prefecture, Japan
Roles: Leader and guitarist of the group

Name: [Takahiro Moriuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/159554/Takahiro-Moriuchi)
Date of Birth: April 17, 1988
Birthplace: Tokyo, Japan
Role: Main vocalist of the group

Name: Ryouta Kohama
Date of Birth: September 4, 1989
Birthplace: Osaka Prefecture, Japan
Role: Bassist of the group

Name: Tomoya Kanki
Date of Birth: June 27, 1987
Birthplace: Hyogo Prefecture, Japan
Role: Drummer of the group

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/heichin26)

Kazuho Hyoudou is a Japanese anime screenwriter and light novel writer. Currently a freelancer. He graduated from the Department of Film and Visual Arts in Osaka University of Arts. He previously worked as a production manager at [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise). Later debuting as a screenwriter on [Shutsugeki! Machine Robo Rescue](https://anilist.co/anime/3098/Shutsugeki-Machine-Robo-Rescue/) in 2003. Since then, he has written scripts for several anime series. His more recent notable works include [Tonikaku Kawaii](https://anilist.co/anime/116267/TONIKAWA-Over-The-Moon-For-You/) and [ReLIFE](https://anilist.co/anime/21049/ReLIFE/)

He has also worked as a scenario writer on the Xenoblade Chronicles series of video games by [Nintendo](https://anilist.co/staff/280450/Nintendo)

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Xenoblade Chronicles X (Video Game, 2015) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (Video Game, 2017) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (Video Game, 2022) (Scenario)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/秋山勝仁)

Acknowledged for his work in the [Inazuma Eleven](https://anilist.co/anime/5231/) franchise and numerous [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/) shows in the '90s.

[Website](https://www.aespa.com/) | [Website (Japan)](https://aespa-official.jp/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/aespa.official) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aespa_Official) | [Twitter (Japan)](https://twitter.com/aespaJPofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aespa_official/) | [Tiktok](https://www.tiktok.com/@aespa_official) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/c/aespa) | [Pinterest](https://www.pinterest.de/aespicyclub/?invite_code=136ccd677a374e19a3e35c4098b20896&sender=1016335978316575908) | [Weibo](https://www.weibo.com/aespa)
 
aespa is a South Korean girl group formed by SM Entertainment. The group consists of four members: Karina, Giselle, Winter, and Ningning and debuted on November 17, 2020 with their digital Single *Black Mamba*.

**Members:**

- **Karina (카리나)** - *Leader, Main Dancer, Lead Rapper, Sub Vocalist, Visual, Face Of The Group, Center*
- **Giselle (지젤)** - *Main Rapper, Sub Vocalist*
- **[Winter](https://anilist.co/staff/345160/Winter) (윈터)** - *Main Vocalist, Lead Dancer, Visual*
- **Ningning (닝닝)** - *Main Vocalist, Maknae*

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masuda_anime)

Animation Producer at [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/) and leader of OLM Team Masuda. Formerly affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/Kinema-Citrus) and [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/poipheno) | [Website (Kawamoto Muno Studio)](https://kawamuno.com/)

Together with [Homura Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/119000/Homura-Kawamoto) they make up the studio Kawamoto Muno Studio.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/152630/)._
